title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5902.3 - Preliminary applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5902.3 - Preliminary applications

State Regulations
(a) Before
filing an application as provided in section
5902.4
of this Part, a preliminary
application shall be filed with the CID program manager on forms supplied by
the foundation. In the alternative, an applicant may file a current business
plan. (b) The preliminary
application or current business plan shall be filed with the CID program
manager, together with such available supporting information as may be
appropriate or necessary to enable the foundation to make a preliminary
determination of the technological nature of the project, the feasibility of
the project business plan and its financing, and the feasibility of the
marketing plan. (c) A preliminary
application or current business plan shall be reviewed by the foundation staff
to determine: initial acceptability, conformity to the CID program criteria, conformity to Federal rules and regulations, and completeness. (d) The CID program manager shall notify the
applicant of the acceptability of the preliminary application or current
business plan and, if it is accepted, shall invite the applicant to file an
application as provided in section
5902.4
of this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5902.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
